channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report E-2024120199
item.description:
Report E-2024120199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 3ft-by-3ft of the trailer floor and 8ft-by-6ft of the concrete lot due to a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. EnviroServe deployed granular absorbents to the areas and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120125
item.description:
Report E-2024120125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 5, 2024, one (1) 40-pound box of HA Powder was crushed and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all impacted materials into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
